documents.document:
Do You Seek A Skin Tag Removal Solution - Answers To The Con

Skin tags appear on the skin and grow at varied rates, ending up in sizes that differ from one person to another. Being benign in nature makes it possible for one to decide not to seek for skin tag removal, and this will not pose any risk. People want the tags gone based on a cosmetic goal, and the other is because the tags are itchy due to size. As they gradually increase in size, they chafe against clothes and the itching intensifies.

You can deal with the tag yourself that is if you know how to go about it, or opt to seek medical treatment from a qualified doctor. But it's not easier said than done. You should have knowledge about skin tags in general, about your particular skin tags, about the various treatments and how they are applied, and how the treatment will turn out when you use it. This is most applicable to skin tags that are still small and are only starting to grow. But if you are not confident, then you should most definitely seek a doctor's expertise since they are more qualified to handle larger skin tags.

People can find simple ways of removing the small tags right at home, because the tags tend not to bleed out. Bleeding, however, is quite possible for big skin tags, making it necessary for you to go to a doctor and have him administer a medical treatment for it. But the location of the skin tag is quite a huge consideration. Some skin tags grow in parts of the body that cannot be treated by home remedies and would require the expertise of a doctor and the preciseness of a medical treatment.

The reason most people opt to conduct their Skin tag removal at home is because it costs less that way. The use of home remedies will be within one budget, and it entails little to no risks because it involves the use of natural products mostly from food sources. Tea tree oil and castor oil are the most common remedies, along with items such as vinegar, garlic and lemon, and other similar products. It may take a longer period before the skin tags will completely disappear when you use home remedies; nonetheless, they are very effective. There is also the added advantage of skin rejuvenation when you use these treatments to remove skin tags.

Modern medical skin treatments are also applicable to small skin tags, but they are more recommended for tags of a larger size. In this approach, one option is surgery, which can give you fast results. However, it can also cost quite a lot of money. Aside from the popular Lasik technology, other methods are also available, including the pain-free method of freezing. Nevertheless, the healing duration will vary depend on the surgical approach one takes, so consult with the doctor about all options. Medicines can be prescribed by doctors, and this is considered to be a cheap skin tag removal method that will solve your skin tag problems in a short period of time.

The Role Of Skin Tag Size In Choosing A Treatment For Skin T

Medical research proves that skin tags are not cancerous and pose no dangers. We sometimes tend to prefer to ignore the small growths when they appear on our skin. If they remain small, we can forget they-re there. However, when they show signs of growing to greater sizes, we scramble to find an effective skin tag treatment to get rid of them. Skin tags are somehow likened by many people to warts. As a result, wart treatments are often attempted to treat skin tags since they think they are treatable that way. But skin tags and warts are different. Skin tags are shaped differently and their size could be as big as a grapefruit. Skin tags can grow in groups, clumped together. This makes them noticeable despite their tiny size.



Skin tags that are on the small side are hardly an issue. It is easy to ignore those skin tags that chose to develop in parts of the body that are covered or hidden from view. Small tags are also easily removed if they are dealt with as early as the time they started springing up. In order to prevent the occurrence - and recurrence - of these skin tags, you should immediately go to a doctor for a proper prognosis once the growths start manifesting themselves. Small tags, when treated, will not be as painful as you would think. People who have had skin tags before are in a better position to find out which medication to use, which natural remedies to apply, and which treatments to choose when dealing with skin tags.

It is, however, unfortunate, that skin tags do tend to grow and worsen in some people, especially when it comes to their size and sensitivity. It becomes especially painful when the skin tags grow on sensitive body parts that are constantly exposed to friction and contact with skin or clothing. But these skin tags can also start to bleed, especially when there is too much friction or abrasion. That bleeding could actually lead to further problems. When you normally would not worry about dangers or risks posed by skin tags, now you are faced with a potential problem. Do not risk more complications and inviting the possibility of having other infections. When you notice the problem becoming worse, seek treatment for it immediately.

The first concern of the dermatologist when faced with a case like this would be to staunch the bleeding. The choice of skin tag treatment would be greatly influenced by the dimensions or the size of the skin tags that will be treated. It is noticeable how small tags often appear in parts of the body that are exposed to cool air, whereas the larger skin tags often develop in warm areas of the body that are often covered from view. Don-t be surprised to find skin tags appearing on the area around the anus and the underarms. Friction is heightened in these body parts, so if the tags appear in them, expect some itchiness. That is why it is important to choose your treatment method carefully.

The process known as cauterization is the most often preferred treatment for these areas. These procedure would have the person-s skin tags singed or burned off by placing a hot metal on them. Despite some pain involved in this process, it has the added advantage of ensuring the tags will not grow back. The risk of infections is also very low. Freezing large skin tags is also common when dealing with tags in these parts of the body; however, it not highly picked due to costs. Or you could also try out the Lasik skin tag treatment, which is gaining a lot of popularity over the years.

Remove Your Skin Tags Through Traditional And Modern Methods

No matter what the age of a person is, skin tags could appear on his or her skin. Whenever, one appears, it does not raise an alarm in many people and its simple ignore. They only start becoming alarmed and seek help in removing the
skin tag when they start appearing in large numbers and in concentrated parts of the body. There will be a mad scramble to look for methods - both conventional and modern - that will get rid of the skin tags effectively and permanently. What they don't see is that skin tags are not really harmful and if they choose the wrong method, that fact could change.

Both modern and conventional solutions to the skin problems will need one to follow a few important steps. The first is to ascertain that they have not biological defects in their body makeup that would result to the condition. This means they have to seek a doctor's option about the situation. A dermatologist will do a test to affirm that there are no other underlying issues with the condition; results that have a higher percentage of giving the same in many who face the skin tag condition. If all is clear, the medical process could then begin.

If time is of the essence and you need the skin tags gone quickly, you could turn to modern medicine for solutions. But these usually cost a lot of money, and many patients just do not have the money to spare. Thus, they turn to removal creams instead. The market is full of these creams and most are available across the counter in many pharmaceutical stores. The creams are not as fast-acting as the modern medical treatments. However, they are just as effective. Other permanent options include Lasik surgery, burning, freezing, and excision.

There are many reasons why people choose the conventional methods over the modern ones. First is the price factor. Second would be the preference for natural products being applied on their skin. People prefer making use of herbal products and applying home remedies themselves. You would commonly find plant extracts and some animal-based components in these products. These products also have the advantage of providing skin nourishment and boosting the health of the person.

Your monitoring of your healing and recovery should also be under the watchful eye of a doctor. One way to monitor your progress while on recovery would be to periodically visit your dermatologist and provide him with status reports. This way, you will know if you are on the right track. If there is a schedule as to how your treatment would be conducted, adhere to it. Do not stray or veer away from it. Regardless of the type of treatment you choose - modern or otherwise - make sure you choose wisely and you tread with caution.

How To Go About Gathering Helpful Information On Home Skin T

Let us take a look at the three most useful ways to obtain reliable information regarding home remedies on skin tag removal. Our in-depth discussion would focus on the methods and they will provide the vital information that we require regarding skin tag removal. In the process, we will also carefully assess the advantages and disadvantages of using these fact-finding approaches. These three methods have been proven effective in getting the skin tag removal information that we require. Of course we are also aware that there are other approaches you can also use. But those are largely unreliable, hence their exclusion from this discussion.

The best way that you can get the information you require on removing skin tags at home is to have a discussion with your dermatologist. Dermatologists are doctors who are trained on all things related to the skin. If given a choice, the dermatologist would not immediately teach you how you can perform skin tag removal at home. Instead, he will attempt to persuade you to allow him to perform it himself. You may be able to convince him to teach you eventually if you insist on it. However, you might have to pay quite a hefty sum of money for the consultation with the dermatologist. But you may be willing to let that go because the dermatologist will show you how to do things in a practical manner. That's what sets this method apart: its practicality as opposed to the other method's purely theoretical approach. Aside from that, the dermatologist will also be able to give you pointers on how to remove the skin tags using some precautions for your safety.

If you need more information on how to remove skin tags at home, you can also resort to using the internet for your research. This specific question has been discussed in a lot of articles that you can call up when you go online. You will find that many dermatologists have written scores of articles on the subject, so it's like you also had a consultation with them. Some are, however, written by people who are not exactly experts in dermatology. That fact lowers the reliability factor more than a notch or two of researching the matter online. The reliability of the information would have to be ascertained first by making sure of the sources first. You would not be required to pay for any fees for consultation or such since the articles are found on public sites that you can access freely.

And the third way in which you can get reliable information on how to remove skin tags at home is by reading (library) books on the same. There are scores of books on skin diseases that you can read and you will find many topics on skin tag removal on them a well. This method is hardly a fast one, though. You have to go through many books and skim though numerous chapters and sections before you can finally get all the information that you deem would be useful. Most of these books may also be highly technical, making use of medical terms that you, a layman, would have trouble deciphering. But since dermatology books have been written by the authorities on the subject, you can be sure that the reliability of the information you will get from the books is very high.

Your Top Three Medical Professionals Who Can Remove Your Ski

Let us take a look at the three types of medical practitioners who could have the necessary training for skin tag removal. In doing this, we will be actually answering the often asked question, as to which medical professionals can help with skin tag removal issues. The process of removing skin tags cannot really be termed as being a very complex medical procedure. It is, indeed, something that many people are able to undertake at home, by themselves. The reason some people opt for skin tag removal in a clinical setting is to ensure the whole process will be safe for them. Clearly, this shows that you can remove the skin tags in a clinic or in your home, depending on your choice. Still, who would perform the actual removal of a skin tag if the clinic is the venue chosen by the patient? We explore answers to that question, as we look at three types of medical practitioners who typically have training on how to go about removing skin tags.

The dermatologist is the first medical professional who just might have the proper training needed for skin tag removal. They are, in fact, supposed to be the specialists in this issue, seeing as they are skin experts. A dermatologist should find it a very easy task to deal with unwanted skin tags. When presented with the skin tag condition, he will be able to tell right off the bat if it is indeed a skin tag or another condition entirely. Diagnosis is necessary as nonprofessional might mistake something else for skin tags. He will also be able to help you out if you have a problem with skin tag removal gone wrong in the past. The simple nature of the skin tag removal process actually lowers the risks of complications to something close to zero. Of course when there are complications, your best bet to have it corrected would be the dermatologist. If you also have other underlying conditions of the skin, the dermatologist would also be able to warn you when he sees it as he performs skin tag removal.

The second type of medical practitioners who may have training on removal of skin tags is that of general physicians. As mentioned earlier, we have a non-complex medical procedure here. That should make it easy for the general physician to perform the procedure. Since a layman or any regular person can remove their own skin tags with no problems at all, what more with a medical professional - a general doctor - who has his medical education and background in his favor. Before the general physicians earned their degree in medicine, they are bound to have been training for instances similar to this.

Finally, there is the physician's assistant. They are in the third group of type of people who may be aware as to the proper way of removing skin tags. Their knowledge and training qualifies them to perform simple medical procedures. Skin tag removal, as mentioned earlier is a non complex procedure. You will be able to come across physicians who are confident in their assistant's ability to perform the skin tag removal themselves.

How To Get Rid Of Skin Tags Easily



The issue of removal of skin tags is not a cause of concern. There are numerous reasons why this is so. The tags themselves are the result of excess skin your body has no use for and this causes an accumulation that manifest itself in a tag. These occur more often in people who have experienced fluctuations in their weight or have encountered skin sagging due to the aging process.

The tag which is left behind on your body is completely unnecessary and your body can manage fine without it. This is why the removal process is one which is easy and can be done without worry. The only issues that you may face come when there are other complications or the tags in question happen to be awkwardly placed.

There are a number of products which are currently on the market that can help you to deal with it just by applying an ointment. This works on wearing the actual tag down. It is then a matter of time before the tag falls off naturally like dead skin. If you want to know which one will work best then you can discuss this with your pharmacist.

The matter is something which you can have dealt with by contacting your doctor as well. Having set up an appointment they will take a look at where the tags are. This brief physical analysis gives them the necessary insight into the possibility of complications and will let them know the best course of action for them to take.

They can either be cut off, frozen off or in more difficult cases they can use laser surgery in order to assist with the removal process. Most doctors can do this with relative ease and once it has happened there is little chance you will experience side effects.

You can also opt to perform this procedure without consulting any medical professional or using pharmaceutical products. Cutting it off yourself is a real possibility. It can cause you a little pain but this can be kept to a minimum when you do things quickly and take care with regards to hygiene.

If this is the case it will reduce the chances of anything going wrong while you are carrying out the procedure. Clean the area and the scissors you intend to use and then snip the tag from its base. In moments the tag will have been taken care of. Any bleeding can be quelled and then cleaned to avoid infection occurring.

The simplest approach to employ when it comes to how to get rid of skin tags is something that has been done for generations and involves cutting of the tags blood supply. Tie some thread around the area and leave it. After a while it withers and falls off. This usually happens in a few days.

Get Rid Of Skin Tags Naturally

Although skin problems don't have much of consequences, they are still a trouble for some people. Skin tagare one of such problems that many people face. Tags are small protrusions which arise on the skin. They are normally in varying sizes. They can be so small that they are hardly visible and can be 1-2 cm in size. Generally they are of skin color but at times they are darker. People with a dark skin color will generally bear darker tags. They can appear on any kind of skin.

Such tags are more common in people of older ages than among youngsters. Normally people above thirty suffer more but they may appear earlier due to some reason. Tags are not a sign of any major skin problem so one must relax on their appearance. They are benign, people generally want to get rid of tags mainly because they would not like any outgrowth on their skin. A lot of medicines are available in the market for such treatments and frankly speaking not all of them work well. Some of these medicines may affect the skin negatively.

Tags can be found on any part of the body and do not follow any particular appearance pattern. Tags are generally more common in body parts which are in direct contact with other body parts or with one's clothes. Tags appear mostly on the neck, in armpits, under the neck and private parts. Tags usually do not disappear on their own but there may be occasions when they do fall off the skin due to constant rubbing with the clothing. One should not try any medicine or ointment without consulting a doctor.

Skin tags can be removed with a variety of methods such as use of surgical techniques, by freezing or burning them using special equipments and technology. A surgical treatment may result in skin problems like itching or skin burning and therefore, such a treatment is not usually recommended by the doctors. To avoid any negative fallout's, use of ointments should be resorted since they are generally without any side effects. Such ointments generally dry up the tag by disallowing any nutrients reaching it. Use of ointments results in removal of tags in a safe and effective manner without any negative effects on either body or health thus restoring skin to its original condition and fresh look. Elderly people should consult family physician or a dermatologist before using the medicines because their skin are more sensitive and may respond negatively to the medicines. A safe treatment varies from person to person and one treatment may not be safe for everyone..

Ways To Remove Skin Tags

A skin tag, in simple words, is nothing but an extended flesh. 'Acrochorda', most popularly known as skin tags are benign and not at all hurtful. They can be found everywhere but mainly they are found on armpit, eyelids, neck, groin. Skin tags are result of a skin rubbing against the skin.

Curing skin tags is possible, indeed. You can remove them yourselves or an option of seeking the help of dermatologist can be exercised. Curing skin tags does not necessarily involve heavy surgery. In fact, their removal is not a necessity, till they irritate and create a cause of concern. Forming of new tags even after dropping-off of old tags is possible.

Surgery is very pricey, hence treating skin tags at home always gets an upper hand. Applying a fingernail polish three times a day till the skin tag falls off. It is simple remedy of all. Another solution for this is to fix band aid with Vitamin E onto the skin tag. You will have to wait a little and it will fall. Using a disinfected scissor to pluck the tag is indeed a faster way but two things should be kept in mind:1. Scissor should be disinfected and 2. You may require alcohol afterwards to rub on the skin to prevent infection. You may consider tying the base of the tag by dental floss. You may wonder, but the logic behind such method is to cut the blood supply, which will eventually result in it's fall. Also, consider using apple cider vinegar for the same to see desirable results within three weeks. Skin tags, when treated at home, may not guarantee safety. After removing a skin tag at home, it may bleed, so one should see a doctor, if the bleeding persists.

In the market, one can find many over-the-counter products that are used in treatment of skin tags. To avoid side-effects, one can chose medicines involving natural components, instead of those with chemicals in them. A range of homeopathic products is also available in the market.

Variety of skin-tag-removal products is prevalent in the market, enabling the consumer to make wise decision. Performing a surgery is lat alternative.
Normally, a person having skin tag suffers from lack of self-confidence and self-esteem. Apart from physical effects, it also makes psychological effects on an individual.

One of the methods to prevent skin tags is to lose the weight. Hormonal levels amongst the pregnant women make it a difficult to prevent skin tags. Avoiding junk food is the best solution not only to control harmful calories in your body but surprisingly also to prevent skin tags.

Whether genetic transmission is one of the reasons behind skin tags or not is not yet firmly proved by the medical science. It is mainly found in the people with the diabetes. Illegal steroid use is one of the reasons behind formation of skin tags. People over forty have more skin tags as compared to others. In spite of their removal, they tend to grow on the skin on any part of the body.

One need not fear skin tags as it hardly needs any treatment, if they are very small in size. So, have no fear of skin tags.

Getting rid of skin tags.

Having your skin tags removed would mean experiencing a lot of pain. Now getting rid of them can be done easily and with less pain. It is important for you to know how to remove skin tags. Before moving on to different skin tag removal methods, make sure first if it has to be removed. Will it cause harm to the body, if it remains there forever? The answer is an emphatic 'No'.

Others are led to believe that skin tags are cancerous. These are all false statements. Skin tags do not have any connection with the term 'cancer'. This is not worth worrying. Therefore, there are no pressing medical justifications to remove skin tags. The main reason why it is removed by people is due to the fact that it affects their physical beauty. Of course, given the choice between unblemished, flawless skin and one with warts and skin tags, you would prefer the former.

It is beauty-related more than health-related that tags are subjected to various treatments to remove them. Thus the amount of money that you wish to spend need not be so high. You can choose between surgical procedures and natural treatments. Home remedies are also known to be quite effective. It's also all right, if you decide that you don't really need any treatment at all.

There's no need to subject yourself to surgery, if you've come to terms with having a skin tag anyway. Using dental floss or a string to remove skin tags requires a lot of care and caution. You have to tie only the lower region or the narrow base of the skin tag. If you tie the wrong region or if you apply too much of force, this might lead to the problem of excessive bleeding.

Freezing can also help pinch off the skin tags. Nitrogen is liquid in the freezing method. Since you will be handling chemicals, make sure to wear gloves. Burning the skin tags is also considered to be a wonderful option. This is tried out by many people. Burning will be done using the electric cautery.

If you want the simplest method, use scissors. But this procedure can be a little painful. You can have anesthesia when using this method.

You may not need anesthesia if the skin tags are small, anyway. Doctors would suggest anesthetics when dealing with larger skin tags. Lidocaine will be injected, before removing the skin tags. Another option is topical anesthesia.

Betacaine cream will be used or LXM 5 % percent cream will be used. The methods on removing skin tags will greatly benefit the people whose skin tags are in visible parts of their body.

Eliminating skin tags

Having your skin tags removed would mean experiencing a lot of pain. Now getting rid of them can be done easily and with less pain. Everyone should know how to get rid of skin tags. But before you go about learning different ways to remove skin tags, ask yourself first; 'Does it have to be removed?' Will it cause harm to the body, if it remains there forever? The answer to that question is no.

Some people have the fear that the skin tags can lead to cancer. There is no truth in those statements. Skin tags are in no way connected to cancer. You need not be worried about this. Hence, there are no medical reasons for you to remove skin tags. People have skin tags removed for the simple reason that they ruin attractiveness or beauty. There is no contest when choosing between tag-riddled skin and skin that is unmarred with any imperfection.

If you decide to have treatment like freezing the tag or burning skin tags, it is purely for beauty-related reasons and not due to health concerns. Thus the amount of money that you wish to spend need not be so high. You can choose between surgical procedures and natural treatments. Some home remedies also seem to be highly effective. It's also all right, if you decide that you don't really need any treatment at all.

If you have accepted having skin tags and you're all right with it, there's no need to undergo any surgery. Using dental floss or a string to remove skin tags requires a lot of care and caution. You have to tie only the lower region or the narrow base of the skin tag. If you tie the wrong region or if you apply too much of force, this might lead to the problem of excessive bleeding.

The skin tags can also be pinched off the skin by freezing it. Nitrogen is liquid in the freezing method. If chemicals are involved, be sure to wear gloves. Burning the skin tags is also considered to be a wonderful option. It has been tried by many people. An electric cautery is used in this process.

Scissors are still the simplest skin tag remover. But this procedure can be a little painful. It is done either using anesthetic or without it.

If the skin tag to be removed is very small, anesthesia may be too much. Doctors would suggest anesthetics when dealing with larger skin tags. You will be given a dose of Licodaine before the skin tags are removed. You can also opt for topical anesthesia.

The recommended ones are Betacaine and LXM 5% cream. The methods on removing skin tags will greatly benefit the people whose skin tags are in visible parts of their body.

What could be the possible cause for the formation of skin t

We all aspire to maintain our bodies and keep them in great shape and good health. If things do not go the way we want to, then the problems start coming in. Even the deceptively normal hormonal changes could bring about a break out of unwanted skin problems such as moles and skin tag

The medical name for what we casually refer to as skin tags is acrochordon. You may also have come across it in your readings as cutaneous papilloma. When you observe the skin tags, you can just a flabby fold of fat, which is held by the stalk. This stalk is referred to as the peduncle. It is very noticeable and distinctive with how soft it is when touched. You can immediately tell it is a skin tag with this telling feature. It is what sets skin tags apart from other types of skin problems. But they all differ in shape, structure and size from person to person.

Alarm is the first reaction of people who see skin tags appearing on their body for the first time. But there is no reason to panic. They are actually normal for some women during pregnancy. The changes that will be brought about by changes in one's hormone levels could be in the organs or could be in the surface of their skin. Seeing the changes clearly with your own eyes will only make you worry even more. If it does not cause you any inconveniences or pain, a doctor's appointment need not be set. Being informed is never a bad thing, so you would be better off knowing about the details of these changes in your body.

Similarly, when you ponder over the cause of the formation of skin tags, you will find that the trapping of collagen result in skin tags. Collagenis only one of the many important layers of proteins and elements under the skin. When a group of collagen and the bunch of blood vessels are piled up over one another, they get trapped within the dermal surface. Skin tags then start to form. Try observing certain infections and you will see their causes and effects being interconnected in some way.

Do you know that simple rubbing of one skin layer over another can lead to skin tag formation? Tight clothes, when donned, can also highly encourage the contact of one layer of skin with another. There will be excessive friction between these two layers. Soon, skin tags will appear.

There are also several other risk factors associated with skin tag development. Skin tags become even more possible for those who take too much steroids. Those who are affected by the human papilloma virus may also suffer from this problem. Unless there is bleeding or you are experiencing pain from your skin tags, there is no need to go to a doctor. If the skin tag does not change in size or dimension, then you are safe. It is not cancerous. Skin tags are also frequently seen among people with diabetes.

Best skin tag remover that can be tried by you

If you have skin problems that you want to get rid of, your search for solutions have probably led you to read so many articles regarding the many available methods or techniques you can use in solving those problems. Lately, skin tag remover creams have been making the rounds. However, you cannot readily purchase all of them from the market. There are certain creams that would actually work for exactly that purpose. Most other skin tag remover creams will just be revealed as scams.

Moreover, big companies will offer skin tag remover promotional creams. The public will be allowed to have these products without paying for them. There is no reason why you should not give them a try. Make it a habit to not put on any cream or gel without having tried the path test first. After finding out that you are not allergic to the cream or gel, you can safely try it out on a larger area. There are also some companies that sell the wart vanishing creams or skin tag remover with a money back guarantee tag. These are bought by many people right off the bat.

Once they find the usefulness of the cream, they buy more. The logical reaction of people who are not satisfied with a product would be to return it to where they bought it from with a corresponding refund of the money they spent on it. But now you would rarely buy creams or gels that do not work. There is a pressure for manufacturers of these creams or gels to outdo and defeat their competition by producing products that are highly effective. Not only do people have to consider the actual effectiveness of the creams, they should also keep in mind that each person has a different skin type. Many people, sadly, forget about this fact. What works for one person does not necessarily mean that it will also work for another person. It works the same way for skin tag removers and mole removers. If they work for you, it does not mean they would also remove the skin tags of everyone else.

The extent of the effect will differ from one person to another as the skin of each person reacts in a different way to these creams or gels. There are cases where complete removal of the skin tags and moles are impossible. While some skin tags will be removed, there are others that will remain, and the moles will only visibly fade, but not disappear. Despite the many chemical gels being churned out constantly, natural remedies are still the preferred options. This will also help in removing the side effects. You do not have to worry about any complications with your skin, too.

You must fully scrutinize the composition of the creams you are planning to buy. There are two main reasons to know the composition. The fist reason is obvious. Knowing the ingredients is one way of ascertaining you will not be having any allergic reaction when you use it. The other reason has something to do with the cost. If rare herbs are used, the product might be a little costly. Here is an example of an herbal cream. You probably see Thuja Occidentais and Melaleuca Alternifolia among the ingredients. You may also find creams containing Ricinus herbs. Make sure you wash your face thoroughly with soap and lukewarm water before putting any cream on your skin.
